snippet: Clashes between rival Christian and Muslim militias made it too dangerous to help the wounded and recover bodies.
abstract: Aid officials say increasingly dangerous level of violence between Muslim and Christian sects in Bangui, Central African Republic, is preventing aid groups from accessing and operating in capital, where clashes have killed at least 42 people.
lead_paragraph: Clashes between rival Christian and Muslim militias made it too dangerous to help the wounded and recover bodies.

headline.main: Central African Republic: Aid Groups Seek Better Access to Strife-Torn Capital
headline.print_headline: Africa; Central African Republic: Aid Groups Seek Better Access to Strife-Torn Capital
